entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs businesses step up criticism of new tax policy: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs businesses step up criticism of new tax policy: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs business community collected more than 2,300 signatures from entrepreneurs on a petition demanding the government repeal a policy that doubles taxes on small businesses. The changes, which business owners say will lead to mass closures, came into force at the beginning of the year. üìç Armenia‚Äôs long-stalled Amulsar gold mine expects to pay some $120 million in taxes every year and create 4,750 direct and indirect jobs once production begins, Lydian Armenia CEO Hayk Aloyan told the Armenpress news agency. üìç A step-by-step guide to Armenia‚Äôs new income declaration system: https://shorturl.at/w83Et

entry.title: Armenian, Georgian, Azerbaijani deputy foreign ministers hold unprecedented trilateral meeting

media:group.media:title: Armenian, Georgian, Azerbaijani deputy foreign ministers hold unprecedented trilateral meeting
media:group.media:description:
üìç A group of displaced Artsakh residents staged a protest outside the Artsakh Representation in Yerevan, demanding the return of allegedly embezzled funds from the breakaway republic‚Äôs Investment Fund. üìç Four people were charged with vote buying in connection with last month‚Äôs municipal elections in Gyumri. üìç In a rare diplomatic move, the deputy foreign ministers of Armenia, Georgia, and Azerbaijan met in Tbilisi to outline their visions for potential areas of regional cooperation. üìç Ambitious Academic City project raises concerns over feasibility and vision: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/945682/ambitious-academic-city-project-raises-concerns-over-feasibility-and-vision/

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Constitutional Court holds up controversial asset confiscation law

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Constitutional Court holds up controversial asset confiscation law
media:group.media:description:
üìç Gyumri‚Äôs new mayor, Vardan Ghukasyan, tells CivilNet he will work with Armenia‚Äôs central government despite deep disagreements with it. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Constitutional Court has largely upheld a controversial law allowing authorities to confiscate assets from former state officials and their relatives if those assets are suspected to have been obtained illegally. üìç Iran, Turkey, and Azerbaijan‚Äôs opposing paths on political Islam - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0pHPuc84FiM

entry.title: Aliyev‚Äôs constitutional referendum & the war on Artsakh Armenians

media:group.media:title: Aliyev‚Äôs constitutional referendum & the war on Artsakh Armenians
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian dedicates the entire show to the sharp reduction in state support for Artsakh refugees and examines what appears to be a politically motivated campaign against them. He breaks down the cuts in financial aid, the housing crisis, and the barriers to integration faced by displaced families and former servicemen. Eric also discusses the rise in hate speech campaigns against them- which he links to the government‚Äôs push for a controversial constitutional referendum.
